summary: This document is an email chain from October 2019 regarding a late travel voucher for a DOJ employee's trip to Santa Monica for witness interviews in the case U.S. v. Epstein. The trip occurred in September 2019, and the correspondence shows administrative follow-up on reimbursement.

events.title: Witness Interviews Trip for U.S. v. Epstein
events.description: A DOJ employee traveled to Santa Monica to conduct witness interviews for the case U.S. v. Epstein.

keyFacts: A DOJ employee traveled to Santa Monica from September 17-20, 2019 for witness interviews in the case U.S. v. Epstein.
The travel voucher for this trip was late, prompting automated and manual email reminders in October 2019.
The trip purpose is listed as 'R19NYS13842 - U.S. v. Epstein - Witness Interviews Trip', indicating ongoing investigative activity in the Epstein case at that time.
The correspondence is between a DOJ employee and an automated travel service (E2Solutions/CWT Satotravel), discussing reimbursement procedures.
The email chain shows administrative follow-up on government travel related to the Epstein investigation.
